body: I'll have to get a Windows XP VM to fix this. For the time being I suggest you redownload an older version and disable upgrades.

Can you do me a favour and find kernel32.dll in `C:\Windows` or `C:\Windows\System32` and upload it somewhere? 
That will save me from the hassle of installing Windows XP.

Uploaded here. Just rename it to kernel32.dll.

This should do it:
wget https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3418598/5165720/07e186a4-73f1-11e4-96e1-41c2659f8c3f.jpg -O kernel32.dll

![kernel32 dll](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3418598/5165720/07e186a4-73f1-11e4-96e1-41c2659f8c3f.jpg)

If it's not ok I'll just upload it somewhere else.

# 

Edit:

Just to be sure it's ok.
Mediafire link: http://www.mediafire.com/download/bd21k8aiarf3suv/kernel32.dll
Yeah, no Symlink support in the kernel on Windows XP, so I cannot fix it, but I guess I need to make it not blow up on Windows XP, as that's the best I can do.
@AudriusButkevicius We should probably re-release when this is fixed. Don't know how many people are still on XP, but >0 for sure. :)
Yep... It's not that I like WinXP but that's the OS I have at work so I've got to go with it.

Well there is a workaround (use v0.10.6), and v0.10.7 doesn't have any killer features that you could not live without, hence the re-release could wait until the next cycle which as you've suggested should be some time next week.
Reverted to v0.10.6 on XP and it's ok. Lubuntu 14.04.01 has no problem with v0.10.7.

@AudriusButkevicius Probably jump to 1.4 pretty quickly, especially if there are features we want.

Wouldn't a recover in init() be enough to catch this and disable symlink support?

It would and that's probably what I'll do as a quick fix.
Starting a XP VM as we speak.

Given 1.4 is coming to town, I'd be in favor to remove all the homebrew stuff I have in place.
Cool, I just pushed just that to get a build from the build server to see if it works. :)
Does http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-branch/1304/ run? I have an XP image at work somewhere, but...

Yeah, fighting Virtual box at the moment.
Give me a few minutes while I get the Hyper-V image.
